intro: Diphyllarium, commonly known as the two-leafed plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves, which are often arranged in a basal rosette. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia, where it thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
